body: Hello, Quick question: Per image attached, what is wrong with the output colors appearance?  I am new (very new —first post) to GH & LB, already in love though...so thank you all for your hard work on these amazing tools! In more words, for some reason the image generated is producing a textured surface and gradient. Grid is set to 4 (meters) so it should not be the reason, any idea...perhaps something in rhino options I need to change...I am not sure.  Big Thanks!![](http://api.ning.com:80/files/PyPlrJLAwZdiCVnoGqNpmpmsIYvHutI6Xxkgdx9F3PovW4UausLSrbeCOrVDBnqOhAtSkJCFVdcSDkAhvMC2K16Fz7jMZgEV/sunlighthours.JPG)

replies.body:
Hide the Rhino geometry and/or the base geometry in GH.

-A.

Abraham Thanks.  I hid the geometry, problem remains. I does look as if multiple surfaces were plotted... ugh??? Will continue working on data generation for now, and research meanwhile what the problem here is... Thanks again! N—[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/vvHEZw33BGpdqrT7A16QNAVh0BjhEi*2VfsSCdPIWOMDqsRRt7nmpmKH21O5tluAufypOce0hNxEr-DCb*ZsZLxN7YQsOYb8/sunlighthours2.JPG)

For sure you are showing at the same time the analysis results and the geometry, either in Rhino or in GH. 100%

Hide the results and you'll see.

-A.

You got it. 

Both Rhino+GH, needed to be hidden.

Did not get this in the tutorials.

BIG Thanks!

N—
